original: Linnaeus drew upon the work of Rumphius and engaged in correspondence with various individuals worldwide while developing the biological classification system that forms the foundation of much of the biological sciences today. In the 19th century, Charles Darwin, recognized as the 'father' of evolutionary theory, took an interest in the local biological knowledge of the diverse cultures he encountered during his voyage on the HMS Beagle
